content:
advertisement

The Penn State Songwriters isnt wasting any time in getting its name out PERIOD

Although its only a month old the group will hold its first open mic event tonight in the Pollock Cultural Lounge PERIOD Each performer will receive  to  minutes to perform depending on participant turnout PERIOD

Songwriters President Brian Walker hopes to set the event apart by the content of its performers PERIOD Walker juniorpsychology wants to foster a relaxed attitude to attract participants PERIOD

 he said PERIOD 

Maura Westurland cofounder and vice president of the Songwriters is looking forward to hearing performers personalities coming out through their music PERIOD

 Westerlund freshmancommunications said PERIOD

But the open mic night isnt just about music PERIOD The atmosphere of the night is pretty much a freeforall Walker said PERIOD

 Westerlund said PERIOD 

The members of Songwriters also emphasize their openness to new performers and members PERIOD

 Walker said PERIOD 

Miles Wright the Songwriters treasurer is just one of the club members who plans to perform tonight PERIOD

Wright who plays the guitar and flute said he enjoys improvising music especially when he can play with others PERIOD

Organizing its first open mic didnt come easy for the group PERIOD On top of jumping through hoops and trying to find a suitable room several club members spent their Sunday evenings posting flyers on as many bulletin boards as possible PERIOD

 Westerlund said PERIOD

And like most organized club events there is always the opportunity to meet new people PERIOD

 Westerlund said PERIOD 

If youre interested in submitting a Letter to the Editor click here PERIOD

Were always interested in hearing about news in our community PERIOD Let us know whats going on
